meanings.definition: To judge beforehand without full examination or evidence.
meanings.sent1: She decided to prejudge the situation before hearing all the facts.
meanings.sent2: It's not fair to prejudge someone without knowing the whole story.
meanings.sent3: He always likes to prejudge movies based on their trailers.
meanings.sent4: Don't prejudge a book by its cover; you might miss out on a great story.
meanings.sent5: Prejudging can lead to misunderstandings and missed opportunities.

meanings.definition: To form an opinion or judgment prematurely.
meanings.sent1: They tend to prejudge people based on their appearance.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to prejudge someone before getting to know them.
meanings.sent3: She likes to prejudge the outcome of games before they even start.
meanings.sent4: Prejudging situations can sometimes lead to wrong conclusions.
meanings.sent5: Prejudging can prevent us from seeing the truth behind things.
